&#3938;&#3999;: [1055] ... 1) phyugs kyi bye brag cig  ... gyi ling rta/ ... zing rta/ ... rta zhon pa/ ... rta rgyab la sgal rma ma bzos na/ sga shing la rma bzo dogs med/ ... ming gi rnam grangs la skal ldan dang/ mgyogs 'gro/ rgya mtsho skyes/ rgyab 'dzin/ rnga yab mjug ma can/ rngog ma can/ rtag tu za/ 'dren byed/ rnam par gnon/ dpal gyi bu/ bang ldan/ blo gsal/ myur 'gro/ rmig pa can/ rlung gi shing rta/ rlung las skyes/ gser ldan bcas so/ 2) skad kyi dbyangs gdangs/ ... dbyangs rta/ ... glu rta/ ... 3) sman 'ded byed kyi btung ba/ ... sman rta chang la byed/ ... 4) lo 'khor bcu gnyis kyi ya gyal zhig  ... shing rta/ ... 5) dor ma'i rta/ ... rta yod/ ... rta med/ ... 6) (mngon) nyi ma la rlung dang/ yid mgyogs/ mdog lnga pa/ thig le can/ nges brjod/ shin tu rgyal mtshan/ ri 'joms te rta bdun yod pas grangs bdun mtshon/ ...

See dor rta.  '*.'  Specialized medical meaning, see sman rta.  'Horse,' the substance on which the medicine figuratively 'rides' into the body. Generally it means sugar, molasses, honey, and possibly beer.  SS 546.5.  = bang ldan, rtag za, rnga rngog 'dren byed, chu 'thung, gshogs pa can.  JD 244.  SS 501.6.
1) *; 2) melody for words; 3) drink as vehicle for med.; 4) hose year; 5) Dor ma'i rta [crotch covering "rta" in front of pants; 6) 7 * ([IW]
